questions.question: Pick the odd one out:
questions.explanation: "Roof" ends with one "f", while the others end with "ff".

questions.question: What's the first sound in "phone"?
questions.explanation: Even though it starts with "ph", "phone" begins with the "f" sound.

questions.question: Which word has the most "f" sounds?
questions.explanation: "Fluff" has two "f" sounds, at the beginning and end.

questions.question: Which word starts and ends with the "f" sound?
questions.explanation: "Fluff" starts with "f" and ends with "ff", both making the "f" sound.

questions.question: In "buffalo", where do you hear the "f" sound?
questions.explanation: The "f" sound in "buffalo" is in the middle of the word.

questions.question: Which word has a different "f" sound spelling?
questions.explanation: "Phone" uses "ph" to make the "f" sound, while others use "f".

questions.question: What's the last letter in "cliff"?
questions.explanation: "Cliff" ends with "ff", and "f" is the last letter.

questions.question: How many sounds are in "ph"?
questions.explanation: Although "ph" has two letters, it makes one "f" sound.

questions.question: Which word doesn't have the "f" sound?
questions.explanation: "Though" doesn't have the "f" sound, while the others do.

questions.question: Hear the word and choose the correct spelling:
questions.explanation: The word “feel” is spelt as F-E-E-L. It means an act of touching something.

questions.question: Which word has the "ph" sound?
questions.explanation: "Photo" uses "ph" to make the "f" sound.

questions.question: How many "f" sounds are in "giraffe"?
questions.explanation: "Giraffe" has one "f" sound at the end.

questions.question: Which word ends with "ff"?
questions.explanation: "Puff" ends with the double "ff" sound.

questions.question: What's the first sound in "photograph"?
questions.explanation: "Photograph" starts with "ph", which makes the "f" sound.

questions.question: What makes the "f" sound in "Physical"?
questions.explanation: In "physical", "ph" makes the "f" sound. Like /fee/ in the starting.

questions.question: Pick the odd one out:
questions.explanation: "Fish" starts with the letter "f". Every other word starts with "Ph".

questions.question: How many "f" sounds are in "fluff"?
questions.explanation: "Fluff" has two "f" sounds, at the beginning and end.

questions.question: Which word has a different spelling for the "f" sound?
questions.explanation: In "laugh", "gh" makes the "f" sound and there is no “f” in this word.

questions.question: Hear the word and choose the correct spelling:
questions.explanation: The word “dolphin” is spelt as D-O-L-P-H-I-N. It is an animal that lives in water.

questions.question: How many "f" sounds are in "flip-flop"?
questions.explanation: "Flip-flop" has two "f" sounds, one in each part of the word.
